intro: Aglaonema commutatum var. elegans, commonly known as the Chinese Evergreen, is a tropical evergreen plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, variegated foliage that displays shades of green, white, and pink. The plant belongs to the Araceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Its leaves are typically oval to lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy texture. Aglaonema commutatum var. elegans is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and air-purifying properties.
